fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.http

Interface IFilteringService


  • @PluginService
public interface IFilteringService
    Filters HTTP requests mapped to an address space. Has access to incoming and outgoing HTTP headers. Can intercept requests to stop further processing by implementations of IAddressableService. Multiple filters can intercept the same address space.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be immutable and therefore completely thread-safe. No mutable state should be maintained between requests. For example, you must not store references to IHttpServiceCall in fields of instances of this interface; you should instead pass such objects as method parameters, if you need to share access to stateful contextual data.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      boolean filter(IHttpServiceCall call)
      Filters the request, enabling the service to inspect headers, and access session and request attributes, or even to respond fully to the request and prevent further processing.
      String getAddressSpace()

    • Method Detail

      • getAddressSpace

        String getAddressSpace()
        Gets the path mapping for this filter. The value of this mapping must not change when the service is registered.

        It can contain a relative path, and optionally indicate specific file patterns to handle. The path may be marked as matching recursively by specifying "*" at the end of the path part of the address space. If no file patterns are specified, then all files can match.

        A single wildcard may be specified at the start or the end of the file part of the address space. When a wildcard ("*") is specified as part of file pattern, the literal part of the file pattern is forced to lower case for pattern matching. No other rules exist to force case conversion.

        Returns:
        a string, starting with "/" (relative to the base path) and ending the path in either "/", "/*", or the name of a specific file or resource. Paths ending in "*" are assumed to match recursively (all subdirectories), otherwise only the directory matching the path is considered a match.

        To indicate matches on specific files only, add a suffix after the path where the suffix is separated from the path by "::" Thereafter, one or more file name mappings may be specified, each separated by ":". File name mappings can optionally start or end with exactly one "*", acting as a wildcard (such as "filename.*" or "*.extension"). The filter prefix "::" is optional for an address space that matches an exact path (no wildcards).

        Filenames containing either ":" or "*" are not supported as part of an address space definition, to avoid confusion.

        Since:
        1.0

      • filter

        boolean filter(IHttpServiceCall call)
        throws IOException
        Filters the request, enabling the service to inspect headers, and access session and request attributes, or even to respond fully to the request and prevent further processing.

        This can be used (for example) to determine if a request originated from an authenticated user. However, it is not used to abort request processing for unauthenticated users.

        If a filter returns false, request processing will be aborted. This is generally useful for filtering inappropriate requests or temporarily blocking end users during maintenance (sending back cache-related codes or redirections). By default, returning false will cause the HTTP service to return a status of IHttpServiceCall.HTTP_STATUS_BAD_REQUEST, but you can override this by setting any other return code (except IHttpServiceCall.HTTP_STATUS_OK).

        Parameters:
        call - the HTTP request and response with attributes and content.
        Returns:
        true if the filter was able to correctly perform its work (and therefore processing should continue), or false if processing should be aborted.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the call could not be processed using this filtering service.
        Since:
        1.0
